sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Kiev sees the first Russian attacks in several weeks as Putin remains defiant about US promises of missiles to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine hits out at French President Emmanuel Macron after he suggests people shouldn't be trying to humiliate Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Party goers celebrate the Queen's Platinum Jubilee in style with top bands and a huge light show.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In the first attack for several weeks by Russian forces on the Ukrainian capital Kiev, explosions rocked the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia insists it was targeting storage tanks which it claims were supplied by Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says the rockets struck a site where trains are maintained and that no such tanks were there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the Russian president says the new missiles being promised by the US won't change anything, but said Russia will strike new targets if those deliveries go ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Anyway, all this fuss with additional arms deliveries has only one objective, to drag on armed conflict as long as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But if the deliveries were to happen, we will draw corresponding conclusions and use our own means of destruction, which we have enough of, to strike those targets that were not yet hit by us before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Kiev has escaped serious attacks recently as Russian forces concentrate on the eastern Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia claims its attacks destroyed T-72 tanks that have been given to Ukraine by European countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Battles are raging in neighboring Lysyshchansk and Severodonetsk that Russian forces say they control almost completely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Russian army says some Ukrainian military units have been withdrawing from Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Indeed, we have had a difficult situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As I said earlier, the Russians controlled about 70% of the city, but during the last few days they were pushed back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The city now is divided approximately in half.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They are afraid of walking freely in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, cities such as Irpin continue to recover after citizens began to return last month to what was left of their communities. The wealthy community district northwest of Kyiv was at the front line as Russian tanks pushed forward to the capital. It's now making a slow recovery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's foreign minister Dmitry Kuleba has hit out at comments made by French President

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron. On Saturday, Macron insisted that Putin had committed a fundamental error but that it was important not to humiliate Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Klaiber took to Twitter to voice his concerns. He said such calls would only humiliate France and every other country that would call for it and that the focus should be on how to put Russia in its place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Macron has been aiming to maintain dialogue with Vladimir Putin since the invasion of Ukraine in February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In an earlier statement, he said, we must not humiliate Russia so that the day the fighting stops, we can build a way out through diplomatic channels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I'm convinced that it is France's role to be a mediating power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said, The Russian army can stop burning churches. The Russian army can stop destroying cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Russian army can stop killing children. If one person in Moscow simply gives such an order, and the fact that there is still no such order is obviously humiliation for the whole world. Macron's hopes of talks have been repeatedly criticized by some eastern and baltic partners in Europe as they see it as undermining efforts to push Putin to the negotiating table.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is the moment Iranian revolutionary guards seized two Greek oil tankers in the Persian Gulf last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The country's supreme leader says it's in retaliation for the role Athens played in a U.S. seizure of crude oil from Iranian-flagged tankers that same week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This because of a violation of sanctions imposed by Washington in Tehran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Iranian oil was stolen off the coast of Greece and then the brave soldiers of the Islamic Republic made up for it by seizing the enemy oil ship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The enemy accuses Iran of theft through widespread propaganda in its media empire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But it was they who stole our oil. The seizures have escalated tensions between Iran and the West after talks in Vienna on the nuclear deal have been stalled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since the deal's collapse, Iran has a rapidly growing stockpile of enriched uranium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It insists its current nuclear program is for peaceful purposes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But United Nations experts and Western intelligence agencies say they're mindful Iran had an organized military nuclear program through 2003.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Five European Union nations who fear waves of refugees from impoverished African countries

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: are calling for an end to the EU's voluntary solidarity on migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Interior ministers from the Mediterranean nations of Italy, Cyprus, Greece, Malta and Spain wrapped up two days of talks in Venice on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While fighting illegal migration and smuggling, we're fully in favour of more legal pathways for migration to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We cannot let the smugglers decide who comes and lives in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is why my country is investing in bilateral cooperation schemes with origin countries, offering more opportunities for work permits in exchange for better cooperation in returns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The summit focused only on controlling potential refugees from Africa coming into southern Europe amid concerns of hardship following the blockade of Ukraine's grain exports. It did not address the millions of Ukrainian refugees arriving in northern EU nations. Crowds gather at the viewpoint of Omaha Beach in France. The vast stretches of wet sand extending toward distant cliffs show the immensity of the task faced by Allied soldiers on June 6, 1944. More than 150,000 troops landed on then-Nazi-occupied Normandy shore. We can't forget. We can't forget what happened 78 years ago. And, you know, we're seeing it happen in some ways again. And so people need to open their eyes. And I don't think what's happening in Ukraine is, I don't think people are confused by what's really happening there, especially when certain terms are being used that, you know, brings up and evokes the past in ways that are not appropriate. We're now showing our respects at the site here and to give the grandchildren a sense of what World War II was like, the sort of scenery where they landed on the beaches and the amount of people that have given their lives to sacrifice for the freedom of everyone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Monday marks 78 years since the largest seaborne invasion in history. Each year, ceremonies are held across Normandy to pay tribute to the achievements and sacrifices of those who fought there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Britain continued its huge celebration on Saturday night to mark the Queen's 70 years on the throne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The band Queen, with Adam Lambert, kicked off the party at the palace and were joined by an array of other stars, including Diana Ross and Andrea Bocelli.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The concert was the climax of the third day of public events to mark the 96-year-old monarch's Platinum Jubilee and 22,000 ticket holders surrounded a purpose-built 360-degree stage outside Buckingham Palace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Absolutely brilliant, brilliant. The atmosphere was amazing, just great to be here. Booked it on Tuesday morning, didn't expect to be here, booked it on Tuesday morning, flew out last night

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: and the atmosphere was amazing, couldn't be anywhere else.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Just, I mean, that light show at the end was incredible to see the corgi up there and the horse and just amazing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I've never seen anything like that in my life before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Incredible, just the atmosphere, Buckingham Palace in the background. You can't beat it, you know. Nothing better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The party also included a drone light show, creating images of the Queen, her handbag and a corgi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Estonia's Ott Tanak has won the Rally of Sardinia. His Hyundai took nine out of 18 specials on the Italian island's dirt roads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He finished a minute and three seconds ahead of Irishman Craig Breen's Ford.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Kalle Rovenpira came fifth, enabling the Finn to extend his lead at the top of the World Rally Championship table.
